intro: Gnidia kuntzei, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow or white flowers that are often fragrant, attracting various pollinators. Its hard, dense wood is highly valued for its durability and strength. Gnidia kuntzei is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
